title: Ch5 Factoring - Comprehensive Review
description: 35 questions covering all factoring methods and solving quadratic equations

questions.question: Find the GCF of 18x⁵ and 30x².
questions.explanation: Correct! The GCF of coefficients is 6 (GCF of 18 and 30). The GCF of variables is x² (smallest exponent). So GCF = 6x².

review.info: For GCF of monomials: find GCF of coefficients, then take the smallest exponent for each variable.

questions.question: Find the GCF of 16p⁶q⁴ and 28p³q³.
questions.explanation: Correct! GCF of 16 and 28 is 4. Smallest exponent of p is 3, smallest exponent of q is 3. GCF = 4p³q³.

review.info: This is Self-Study example #1 from the chapter.

questions.question: Factor: 28x⁶ + 32x³
questions.explanation: Correct! The GCF is 4x³. Factor it out: 28x⁶ + 32x³ = 4x³ · 7x³ + 4x³ · 8 = 4x³(7x³ + 8).

review.info: Always factor out the GCF first before any other factoring method.

questions.question: Factor: 12x⁵ - 21x⁴ + 24x³
questions.explanation: Correct! The GCF is 3x³. Factoring out: 12x⁵ - 21x⁴ + 24x³ = 3x³(4x² - 7x + 8).

review.info: Check your work by distributing the GCF back through the parentheses.

questions.question: Factor by grouping: x² + 2x + 4x + 8
questions.explanation: Correct! Group terms: (x² + 2x) + (4x + 8) = x(x + 2) + 4(x + 2) = (x + 2)(x + 4). Note: options A and B are equivalent.

review.info: Self-Study problem #1. When factoring by grouping, look for a common binomial factor.

questions.question: Factor by grouping: 3x³ + 9x² + x + 3
questions.explanation: Correct! Group: (3x³ + 9x²) + (x + 3) = 3x²(x + 3) + 1(x + 3) = (3x² + 1)(x + 3). Don't forget the 1!

review.info: Always include the coefficient 1 when factoring out from terms.

questions.question: Factor by grouping: 2x² + 4x + 5x + 10
questions.explanation: Correct! Group: (2x² + 4x) + (5x + 10) = 2x(x + 2) + 5(x + 2) = (2x + 5)(x + 2). Options A and B are equivalent.

review.info: Self-Study problem #3.

questions.question: Is x² + 8x + 16 a perfect-square trinomial?
options: No, because 8x is not twice the product of x and 4
No, because 16 is not a perfect square
Yes, but only if x is positive
questions.explanation: Correct! x² and 16 are perfect squares (x² and 4²). The middle term 8x = 2·x·4, so it's a perfect square trinomial: (x + 4)².

review.info: Check: (1) First and last terms are squares, (2) No subtraction of squares, (3) Middle = 2·√first·√last

questions.question: Is 25x² - 20x + 4 a perfect-square trinomial?
options: No, the middle term doesn't match
No, 25x² is not a perfect square
questions.explanation: Correct! 25x² = (5x)² and 4 = 2². The middle term -20x = -2·5x·2. So it's (5x - 2)².

review.info: The middle term can be negative. Pattern: A² - 2AB + B² = (A - B)²

questions.question: Factor: x² + 8x + 16
questions.explanation: Correct! Both A and C are the same: (x + 4)² = (x + 4)(x + 4). This is a perfect square trinomial.

review.info: Pattern: A² + 2AB + B² = (A + B)²

questions.question: Factor: 16a² - 24ab + 9b²
questions.explanation: Correct! 16a² = (4a)², 9b² = (3b)², and -24ab = -2(4a)(3b). So it's (4a - 3b)².

review.info: Perfect square trinomials can have multiple variables.

questions.question: Factor: 4x² - 28x + 49
questions.explanation: Correct! 4x² = (2x)², 49 = 7², and -28x = -2(2x)(7). So it's (2x - 7)².

review.info: From worksheet question #15.

questions.question: Factor: x² - 9
questions.explanation: Correct! This is a difference of squares: x² - 9 = x² - 3² = (x + 3)(x - 3).

review.info: Pattern: A² - B² = (A + B)(A - B)
From worksheet question #11.

questions.question: Factor: y² - 16w²
questions.explanation: Correct! y² - 16w² = y² - (4w)² = (y + 4w)(y - 4w).

review.info: Difference of squares works with multiple variables.

questions.question: Factor completely: 5x⁴ - 3125
questions.explanation: Correct! First factor GCF: 5(x⁴ - 625). Then difference of squares: 5[(x²)² - 25²] = 5(x² - 25)(x² + 25). Finally: 5(x - 5)(x + 5)(x² + 25).

review.info: Complete factorization requires multiple steps. Factor until no factor can be factored further.

questions.question: Which of the following is prime (cannot be factored)?
questions.explanation: Correct! x² + 25 is a SUM of squares, which cannot be factored. Only DIFFERENCE of squares can be factored: A² - B² = (A+B)(A-B).

review.info: Sum of squares like x² + 25 or 16x² + 9 are PRIME.

questions.question: Factor: y² - 8y + 15
questions.explanation: Correct! We need two negative numbers that multiply to +15 and add to -8. Those are -3 and -5: (y - 3)(y - 5).

review.info: When c is positive and b is negative, both factors are negative.

questions.question: Factor: x² - 5x - 24
questions.explanation: Correct! We need one positive and one negative that multiply to -24 and add to -5. That's +3 and -8: (x + 3)(x - 8).

review.info: When c is negative, one factor is positive and one is negative. The one with larger absolute value has the same sign as b.

questions.question: Factor: t² + 4t - 32
questions.explanation: Correct! We need factors of -32 that add to +4. That's +8 and -4: (t + 8)(t - 4).

review.info: Since the sum is positive (+4), the positive factor must have larger absolute value.

questions.question: Factor: x² - 3x - 18
questions.explanation: Correct! Factors of -18 that add to -3 are +3 and -6. So (x + 3)(x - 6) or (x - 6)(x + 3) - both are correct!

review.info: From worksheet question #3.

questions.question: Factor completely: 2x³ - 24x² + 72x
questions.explanation: Correct! First factor GCF: 2x(x² - 12x + 36). Then factor trinomial: 2x(x - 6)(x - 6) = 2x(x - 6)². Both forms are correct!

review.info: Always look for GCF first, then continue factoring. This is complete factorization.

questions.question: Which polynomial is prime (cannot be factored)?
questions.explanation: Correct! x² - x + 7 is prime. There are no two integers that multiply to +7 and add to -1.

review.info: A polynomial that cannot be factored is prime.

questions.question: Factor: x³ + 7x² + 12x
questions.explanation: Correct! First factor GCF: x(x² + 7x + 12). Then factor trinomial: x(x + 3)(x + 4).

review.info: Self-Study problem #1. Always factor out GCF first.

questions.question: Using the ac-method, what is ac for 4x² - 5x - 6?

review.info: Step 2 of ac-method: multiply the leading coefficient a and the constant c.

questions.question: Factor using ac-method: 4x² - 5x - 6
questions.explanation: Correct! ac = -24, we need factors that multiply to -24 and add to -5: that's 3 and -8. Split: 4x² - 8x + 3x - 6 = 4x(x - 2) + 3(x - 2) = (x - 2)(4x + 3).

review.info: ac-method: find p and q where pq = ac and p + q = b, then split middle term and factor by grouping.

questions.question: Factor: 2x² - x - 3
questions.explanation: Correct! ac = -6, need factors that add to -1: that's 2 and -3. Split: 2x² + 2x - 3x - 3 = 2x(x + 1) - 3(x + 1) = (2x - 3)(x + 1).

review.info: Self-Study problem #4.

questions.question: Factor: 3x² - 14x - 5
questions.explanation: Correct! ac = -15, need factors that add to -14: that's 1 and -15. Split: 3x² + x - 15x - 5 = x(3x + 1) - 5(3x + 1) = (x - 5)(3x + 1). Options A and D are equivalent.

review.info: Self-Study problem #6.

questions.question: Factor completely: 4t³ - 10t² - 50t
questions.explanation: Correct! First GCF: 2t(2t² - 5t - 25). Then ac-method on 2t² - 5t - 25: ac = -50, factors 5 and -10 add to -5. Split: 2t(2t² + 5t - 10t - 25) = 2t[t(2t + 5) - 5(2t + 5)] = 2t(2t + 5)(t - 5).

review.info: From worksheet question #6. Always factor GCF first!

questions.question: Solve: (x + 4)(x - 3) = 0
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the zero product principle: x + 4 = 0 OR x - 3 = 0. So x = -4 or x = 3.

review.info: Zero product principle: if ab = 0, then a = 0 or b = 0.

questions.question: Solve: x² + 9x + 14 = 0
questions.explanation: Correct! Factor: (x + 7)(x + 2) = 0. Then x + 7 = 0 or x + 2 = 0, so x = -7 or x = -2.

review.info: Steps: (1) Write in standard form, (2) Factor, (3) Apply zero product principle, (4) Solve.

questions.question: Solve: y² + 4y = 0
questions.explanation: Correct! Factor: y(y + 4) = 0. Then y = 0 or y + 4 = 0, so y = 0 or y = -4.

review.info: Don't forget 0 can be a solution!

questions.question: Solve: x² - 12x = -36
questions.explanation: Correct! First get 0 on one side: x² - 12x + 36 = 0. Factor: (x - 6)(x - 6) = 0. So x = 6 (only one solution).

review.info: CAUTION: Must have 0 on one side before using zero product principle.

questions.question: Solve: 9x² = 49
questions.explanation: Correct! Rearrange: 9x² - 49 = 0. Factor difference of squares: (3x - 7)(3x + 7) = 0. So 3x = 7 or 3x = -7, giving x = 7/3 or x = -7/3.

review.info: Get everything on one side first, then factor.

questions.question: Solve: x² + 4x - 5 = 0
questions.explanation: Correct! Factor: (x + 5)(x - 1) = 0. So x + 5 = 0 or x - 1 = 0, giving x = -5 or x = 1.

review.info: Self-Study problem #1.
